imdb_user_reviews.contents: VERY funny -- a very pleasant surprise!
Excellent movie for the whole family to enjoy!
Cavemen to Hunter/Gatherers Now Makes Sense
Behold... A Prehistoric Age Where Humans Still Live... Apparently For Now!
Saw it, loved it, nuff said.
'The Croods' is a fresh tale that invigorates and entertains
What a great memories you brought back to me by this
Clear family relationship traveling through a changing earth
It's hard to describe... really, I don't know if I liked it or not.
Exciting, Interesting and can watch with family !
Great family entertainer with awesome 3D effects
Simple, funny, and sweet -- not 'clever' or 'artistic', but so what?
Stone age family uses wits and luck to find a new home.
A families cave gets destroyed. The family sets out on an adventure to find a new cave to live in but couldn't make it without guy and belt.
Family trips haven't changed ever since the dawn of time.
Everything about this movie is amazing
Visually stunning and very nice story
a stunningly beautiful adventure for the whole family.
Visually beautiful animation with an average script
Great movie, great story! I highly recommend it!
Surprisingly touching, fine entertainment for the entire family
The Croods  A brutish family on a surprising and dangerous hike
Funniest Kid's film so far this year
Move on over Flintstones, there is a new caveman cartoon family in town call the Croods. A modern stone-age family!!
right up there with the best of em'
Great Movie For The Whole Family
Funniest prehistoric family since The Flinstones
Best Animated Movie That I Have Seen Yet!
Absolutely LOVED this movie - a must see with your children and grandchildren!!!
Do not forget to "release the baby,"
Lets just say that this family is different
Interesting traits from stone age to be used in a great animation movie? They got them all!
A caveman family on the move.
Simplistic action comedy in computer game style
In my top five animations of all times!
Well I thought it wasn't bad from the man that brought you Lilo & Stitch and How To Train Your Dragon franchise
Good fun, great voice-cast - highly recommended
Best Film For Kids AND Adults in ages!
Most enjoyable, for young and old(er) :)
Surprisingly a funny and visually beautiful adventure
Cliché and predictable, but good animation and wackiness
Fun Time with a life lesson!
See Geico, Cavemen CAN be funny...
The Croods is a perfect family outing which is surely be enjoyed once you step into the roller-coaster ride
May The Creator of this movie live long to entertain us..
Slow start but very entertaining at the end
After ICE AGE now it's time to explore into STONE AGE
A journey through a brightly colored world and relationships
Croo-oods! Meet the Croo-oods! An Off-Beat Stone-Age Family!
Entertaining family film that is truly enjoyable.
Its like if the Flintstones was about 90% more realistic
The Croods is not going to match the heights of "How to Train Your Dragon" but it's the kind of film that you would enjoy with the whole family.
the croods with a few spoilers
Eye feat with lots of fun
Get your popcorn and get set for full entertainment The Croods (Family Entertainer)
The movie is about a family that is trying to survive the end of the world
If you see one animation this year, make sure it's this one!
Another Product Hot off the Assembly Line
Stop reading reviews and GO WATCH THIS MOVIE ALREADY!!!
7.4 ??? This movie deserves a 10 out of 10.
A good time pass film but, not as great & hilarious as DreamWorks Animation's other staples such as Shrek, Madagascar, Kung Fu Panda, How To Train Your Dragon etc.
Funny, beautiful, entertaining and very creative!
Awwesome chases and images, poor plot
One of the best animation movie I have ever watched
Chix Chat on Film review: Thinking outside the cave.
The Peter Jackson's Avatar of kids movies in the worst ways possible.
Modern Stone Age Family Falls Shy of Expectations
Not Great but it was Good
It seems to go no where fast.
Not a horrible animated adventure, but I've had better....
Fantastic time-waster for the whole family.
Great family movie but often stereotypical.
I've never hated a movie this much before.
Of Unfulfilled Promises and Underachieved Efforts
DreamWorks Have Stepped Down Their Game
A forgettable movie from Dreamworks Animation
Not great but entertaining enough to recommend to parents.
A miss fire from my view
Stay in your cave, unless you want to get out!
Neither magical nor memorable but fine in an emergency with bored kids

mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: A spirited and eye-popping stealth charmer.
Considering the fact that a young girl is picking her nose on the movie poster, The Croods is surprisingly evolved.
This Chris Sanders fellow knows how to craft a heart-warming animation, and if not for a few minor problems this would have had a legitimate shot at the best animated movie of 2013.
Familiar family dynamics are amusingly exaggerated in the Paleolithic setting, where the most basic necessities require everyone's full-time attention.
The first pleasant surprise of spring, a gorgeous kids’ cartoon with heart and wit, if not exactly a firm grasp of paleontology.
As family viewing, it's pleasant enough: primitive, yes, but in a digitally sophisticated way that's boisterous, funny and will no doubt sell a lot of toys.
Although The Croods has lazy patches throughout, the conclusion is exciting and, lo and behold, surprising.

The film itself doesn’t practice what it preaches: From the typically blocky DreamWorks CGI to the emphasis on bruising slapstick over verbal wit, The Croods takes the low road at every opportunity, giving lip service to enlightenment while following a Flintstonian instinct to keep punching the clock at the quarry.
Just good, goofy fun, for a generation too young to have met Bamm-Bamm.
More than anything, the striking spectacle of primordial flora and one-of-a-kind fauna makes it easy for audiences to get pleasantly lost in the adventure.
While paying lip service to the spirit of invention and adventure, the movie doesn’t do much for the evolution of children’s animated entertainment.
The movie is well-edited and lean, a fast-paced, action-filled bit of froth that manages to be diverting and surprisingly fun.
Some of the exotic landscape the group trailblazes looks imported from “Avatar” — happily, bringing that immersively dimensionalized, eye-catching quality along with it.
At least there's Cage, who has become an astute voice actor, finding some odd, clever, energetic line readings consistently fresher than The Croods itself.
The Croods isn’t particularly smart, but it has just enough wit to keep us engaged and just enough speed to keep us from feeling restless.

The movie is at its most interesting and amusing when riffing on how cavemen might have reacted to new experiences and ideas, like fire and shoes. Whether the kiddies will appreciate that is unclear, but they’ll certainly like the voice work done by Emma Stone as Eep.
The Croods are not meant to be beauties — they are, after all, a family of Neanderthals. But is the animation meant to be ugly, too?

The jokes only make up for the pedestrian plot for so long. There was a time when animated fare with generic stories sufficed. But now we expect more from them, because they have, pardon the pun, evolved. The Croods, like its title family, hasn’t.
A handful of adrenalizing sequences of animated anarchy can't save this story from feeling overly primitive.

Though it's impressive in many technical and surface ways, The Croods lets us down on the essentials of character and story, and no amount of late-stage father/daughter bonding or vertiginous 3D cliffside tumbling can make up for that.
It’s "Identity Thief" with flying piranhas, or Plains, Trains & Automobiles on foot.

Good stuff comes when bad stuff happens; that's when some of the movie animation prowess kicks into high gear. But too many of the "solutions" the guys concoct are so impossibly complex or just downright ridiculous — puppetry comes to mind — that like the continents, it's a little too easy to drift away.

Although state-of-the-art in its rendering of textures, movement and stereography, The Croods, adopts a relatively primitive approach to storytelling with its Flintstonian construction of stock, ill-fitting narrative elements.

Sanders and DeMicco’s script doesn’t have the robust plotting, consistent wit or flavorful character development of the best family animation. And some of the voice actors have too little to work with.

Aside from a few witty Looney Tunes–esque sight gags, such as one hilarious image of a woolly mammoth being swallowed up by the tectonically shifting earth, the stereoscopic visuals are a busy, personality-free digital blur.

The Croods does a lot of things well -- even if it does none of them extraordinarily. The end result is a solidly middle-of-the-road bit of animation -- but the kind that is easily forgotten as soon as something more evolved, and original, comes along.
It's amiable enough, but it makes "The Flintstones" look like it was scripted by Karl Popper.
But for the most part it’s Neanderthal compared to the Pixar stable.
The film takes more than a few pages from the James Cameron playbook.

I’d like to take back all those times I said Nicolas Cage was one of the most annoying actors on film. It turns out he’s equally terrible when he’s only on the soundtrack. And yet Cage is the least of the problems with The Croods.

mc_user_reviews.text: While not horribly memorable or spectacular, it is a good kids film. The animation is nice and flashy and the characters have nice little arcs throughout. The first 10 minutes were bad and the end was cheesy but the rest of the film is funny and colorful. That'll be enough to entertain your kids and to keep parents from pulling their hair out.

Believe it or not, this is the best movie I've seen this year.  Don't make the mistake thinking this is only a Kira's movie.  Wildly imaginative and creative.   I saw this with two other adults and we all loved it.

The Croods is a cheer up insightful animation, that will please die hard animation fans, family but mainly kids. It has some great messages about family and life that will please and comfort families. Despite that The Croods is a good family animation, but it has lots of flaws. First of all, it doesn't describe the origins of the family, they are just vessels to move on with the story. Secondly, it has some falling apart moments that bored the hell out of me, also that the story is ridiculous, seriously! What happens to the world ending???
Probably greatest graphic in an animated movie this year (2013)
This is the best animation movie ever made also the best film of 2013 till today.With fresh theme nice humor and awesome 3D effects. Hope they make part 2 of this as soon.

Took my 2.5 yr old to see this, her first ever cinema experience so will always be special for her  a cross between Flintstones, Ice Age & Lion King, a little too many scenes featuring characters falling down but some highly original scenes and a lot of fun. The Metascore is off in this case.

A perfect match for children who love movies such as Ice Age and The Lorax. The Croods is a magical movie with lots of fun and lost of laughs. Very sweet and cute with lots of positive messages about being together with family. The Croods is your ticket to a great child movie.

The Croods is a movie that offers great family filled entertainment and stunning visual 3D effects. Do not let the title fool you. You will not find any “crude” humor in it. It’s a slapstick film. Slapstick done right that is.The story is unpredictable, subtle and smart enough and the fact that it’s an animated feature gave the creators more flexibility in bringing their imaginations to the screen. Taking us with the original “first family” to “follow tomorrow and follow the light”.
It catches the attention from children, but did not achieve any interest, for the similarities from the Flintstones. except that it has good quality, magnificent pilot and a righteous end.

Hilarious movie.  I thoroughly enjoyed it, particularly, "release the baby!" Animation was great, characterization was great, and you can take the whole family.  Little ones might be upset by the intensity of the action but older ones (7-8) will like it.  I laughed out loud.

Very enjoyable cute movie about cavemen with a good cast and cute storyline that goes with it. Some very Cute animals and good jokes which is very entertaining for the kids and as well as the parents. Go see it or buy it on dvd blue ray itunes whatever. (8/10)
To be honest, this was better than I expected. I thought it might just a bunch of cavemen walking around a rainforest, but it becomes a magical journey when you see it, I recommend it.

A lot funnier than i expected, guess it kinda took my by surprise. Not much to say of it. I had fun, that's that. It ain't gonna win any awards or nothing but hey, over all a great kids movie that i enjoyed more than i thought i would.
This may be not first or the second best animation i have ever seen. but the movie is very good, it maskes us laugh and happy

The plot was incredibly predictable, the comedy was bad and the pacing was way too fast during the first three quarters. The film was not creative, the extent of the creativity being animal  other animal/plant. The characters to me were annoying and the majority were completely static, with the exception of Grugg and Eep. After the Tar pit scene, the plot becomes a lot less predictable, and the pacing is better, but I still couldn't care about them. The conflicts were born out of pure stupidity, and there were plenty of plotholes to go around. (Where are the trees? You can't simply survive on eggs you have to risk death to get. At least kill the bloody things.)
A Poor Mans Flinstones? Somewhat....
Ok, this is Dreamworks animation trying again too hard. The animation isn't my personal favorite. Beautiful colors but again I just didn't fall in love with characters or story :0/

Lot of 3-D films don't technically work but The Croods proved my theory wrong. It used 3-D very good (But still not enough). To say the least this movie is similar to Madagascar but still not enough to complete that franchise.

If you were a fan of films such as "The Incredibles"  or "Despicable Me" go see "The Croods". You will laugh (frequently), you will possibly cry (if that's your thing). You will be entertained by this riveting tale of, family, friends, relationships, growth, acceptance and evolution. Highly recommended for all ages.
I think Ice Age already covered what this movie did so I'm in the been-ther-done-that crew. I think a 6 is the perfect rating for this movie. It's kinda funny.

I love this movie! The story line and the animation ticked my senses and captivated my mind. What a great movie! I like how it teaches children that no matter how much your parents don't say that they love you, they are always thinking it, no matter how much a brat they can be. I love unique movies and this one is simply that.
It succeeds in everything, but just barely. It is fun but everthing else from the direction to the characters are just about average. It's a good time but instantly unmemorable.
It was a cute movie, I sort of enjoyed, but it wasn't a memorable one for me. Although I would recommend it for parents who want to watch a movie with their kids.

The film looks great with its bright colors and there is some decent humor, which will entertain the kids but that’s not enough. This film is meh. Outside of the last third, which is somewhat engaging and heartfelt this movie has little to offer. The story and characters are generic containing a lot of stuff that I’ve seen before (some of which from other Dreamworks movies) and there is no good humor or hilarious side character to save this movie. This is disappointing since Chris Miller was working on this movie and he has worked on such Disney films as Mulan along with Dreamworks hits like How to Train Your Dragon. I can kind of feel his touch but not really. Maybe he wasn’t that involved in it though. I heard that originally Aardman was going to make this film but when their deal with Dreamworks ended they got to make the movie instead of Aardman, which is a shame because I would have loved to have seen what Aardman’s version would have been like because knowing them it would have had a lot more heart like Arthur Christmas (which is a great film) and/or humor like Pirates Band of Misfits. Even so this is coming from a studio that has made some pretty good movies such as the first two Shrek movies, How To Train Your Dragon, the Kung Fu Panda films, and most recently Rise of the Guardians. I am shocked that this movie is getting a sequel because this doesn’t seem like the kind of movie that would catch on. I don’t know anyone who saw it and it wasn’t getting that much buzz. However, obviously there are a bunch of little kids that saw this film and liked it and I won’t blame them because there are a lot of mediocre films I saw as I kid that only recently upon a repeated viewing am I realizing are crap (like the Ice Age films). So if you have kids show them this movie it will entertain them but if you are looking for that exceptionally good animated film this ain’t it.

"The Croods is a HUGE achievement for Dreamworks Animation. Visually appealing with a heart-warming story that at times is emotional and very clever. Featuring a nice voice cast, a film that could have been awful, turned out to be quite the opposite." ..B

Dreamworks is making some great animation, and is currently better than Pixar.  The last two Pixar films (Cars2, Brave) were duds.  The animation and 3D of The Croods is excellent.  There are imaginative looking creatures all along the way, and the pacing is frenetic and funny.  It isn't quite as good as How to Train Your Dragon (so far their masterpiece) but it's close.  I thought it would bother me that they used Nicolas Cage as the voice of the father because his voice is so distinctive that it would be distracting, but it didn't turn out that way.  All the voice actors do a fine job.

DreamWorks proves once again that they know how to create a beautifully animated, hilarious, and heartwarming family movie. The all-star voice cast really brings these characters to life, and the movie is filmed to the brim with the non-stop laughs. The story at the core of it all is sweet as well, even if it is a bit familiar. I have to give special praise to the fantastic animation work. It's hard to not believe that the environments and the animals aren't real. They are some of the most lifelike and realistic I've ever seen in an animated movie. The character models also look great, but thanks to their exaggerated features end up looking less lifelike than the environments and animals. However this is still the best looking animated movie I've ever seen, even beating out Pixar's strongest efforts.

"The croods," or is like to call, "Ice Age The Great caveman adventure," is a film made for children and brain dead parents who either are religious and don't seem to find this film offensive, or aren't and are just plain brain dead to begin with.  If you, like me saw the trailer for this film, you might have actually thought that this was Dreamworks making another terrible sequel to the Ice Age series of films, however I was pleasantly surprised after watching the full film from start to finish.  I thought, "Wow, its hard to believe a bunch of morons at Dreamworks thought this garbage would actually sell with Nicholas Cage attached to it."  He's the worst thing in it, he's the worst character, he's the worst voice actor, and he's a detriment to the movie as a whole.  Honestly remove his character and take away the dialogue from the majority of the film?  This would've been great, but yet again its another imaginative film for children that can't even treat its audience like children.  It spells everything out, it has no mystery, it lacks any charm it COULD have provided ultimately.  My biggest issue here though, is the plot is really thin without the inclusion of "Guys" character.  I mean it could've just gone nowhere entirely, but thank goodness they just so HAPPEN to meet another character that just so happens to MOVE the plot along otherwise they would've all died in the cave after the first earthquake I guess.  "Eep" is great, voice work is solid here, but her expressions, character design and general animation are what make her a good character.  Everyone else feels kind of cookie cutter in comparison, aside from "Guy" of course.  Its obvious that its suggesting romance between Neanderthals and Homo sapiens, which is a cute thought, but these two species would've likely attacked and killed eachother on sight as well.  Just a little bit of scientific knowledge to thrown for good measure, since their is absolutely none of it in this film.  Turtles with wings, giant walking land whales, flying piranha birds, strange amalgamations of animals that could've never existed- you name it.  They're all over this movie.  Part of me likes to indulge that kind of imagination and I could see a child being interested in such things, but another part of me is literally shouting internally things like, "This is completely wrong and makes no sense."  All in all, if you edited Nicholas Cage and his character out of the movie, fleshed out the family more and make a better motivation for why Guy and Eep even met up to begin with, it could've been a pretty stellar movie.  Like maybe an arranged marriage or peace treaty between a Neanderthal and Homo Sapien family or tribe perhaps.  Its funny that when I think about when early Homosapiens wandering the Earth that even I could write a better plot about them going on an adventure.  Dreamworks- nice try in attempting to catch lightning in a bottle twice (we know you can't by now).  Turn down the trippy ridiculous Pandora environments and maybe try writing a film that appeals to adults next time.

A Caveman animation almost entirely about family sounds like a generic idea for an animated film but The Croods surprises with its unexpected turns, stellar animation and emotional finale. The film follows a family of cavemen called The Croods who are led by father Grug (Nicholas Cage). However when Grug's daughter Eep (Emma Stone) defies him and leaves the cave and meets Guy (Ryan Reynolds) she learns the end is coming and that she must force her family to change their cave dwelling ways in order to survive, something Grug might be incapable of doing. The Croods is paint by numbers animation with the plot feeling like a rehash of Ice Age with a bit of The Flintstones thrown in for good measure. The film is generic in its plotting and it feels very much like a flash in the pan, a film for now that people won't remember that well in the future. However it does have enough for it to have been a shame to miss. That being said, this caveman saga is hobbled very early on by some lacklustre voice acting, especially by Katherine Keener who plays Grug's wife Ugga. She puts very little into her performance something that becomes very clear towards the end when she under delivers in some key scenes. The film soldiers on though and manages to be unique through its action with some of the set pieces being truly breathtaking. In fact the attention to detail in the movie is remarkable, the world they have created is one untouched by animation so far and for a film that's main colour is brown, that's impressive. The finale of the film is terrific for multiple reasons but the animation is the best aspect, there is enough action and excitement in the ending as there is in the rest of the movie and the animators managed to put enough into their shots so that it looks amazing but doesn't give you a Man of Steel headache. In fact The Croods really comes alive in its ending and differentiates itself from other animated fare with a finale that is action packed, funny and carries one hell of an emotional punch that feels quite familiar but still has the desired effect. Its a well crafted film from the director of How to Train your Dragon and a worthy but not quite as good follow up.
huge surprise of an animated movie! The critics were totally wrong about this one! It was fun to watch, with great animations! and the story was decent as well!

This was a good movie with enjoyable characters. I found myself laughing or smiling constantly. The director made some really good movies in the past, like Lilo & Stitch and How to Train Your Dragon. This was definitely his weakest film, but still good. The one flaw with the movie is that it was very repetitive. The whole movie the family is constantly running from danger and they reused some jokes. I think all kids well like this movie.

The Croods is unique. That is a simple way to put it, but this is the best cavemen movie i've ever seen. The show has it all. Interesting characters, heartwarming moments, nonstop laughs, and beautiful animation. Sure, any computer animated film nowadays can look great, but The Croods stands out for its extremely colorful animation. YOU MUST SEE IT!

The Croods, in a nutshell, is a pretty decent film; it offers exhilarating fast paced and comedic action scenes and slow, story based scenes (also comedic). Although the dialogue isn't particularly clever, it'll do for a simple Dreamworks feature film; it's more visual than vocal for the laughs. The film uses a simple but charming plot causing a simple family of cavemen to go on a long, crazy journey to "Tomorrow" by following the incredibly close sun. It's packed with mildly funny, action-packed, and emotional sequences. The film doesn't really end, as such. It kind of ends with them "going on" towards "Tomorrow". So I give this film a... 72/100!

Again movie critica show us that their jobs are meaningless, especially high end pompeous ones who cant seem to generate an objective review if their lives depended on it. They could at least rephrase "review" to "my opinion". This movie is heartwarming and fits its TARGET AUDIENCE well. Also pretty funny!

Despite a familiar formula from other animated features, The Croods is somehow refreshing amidst Neanderthals during Year 1. Unfortunately, marred with several unimpressive voice-acting performances from Nic Cage and Emma Stone.

“The Croods” has a simple story about old vs. new and family. The family must move when disaster strikes and learn to adapt to new ways of doing things. Resistant at first, they meet a boy named Guy, who helps them rediscover the ever changing world. The film tells us to embrace new things with open arms and enjoy all the wonders life has to offer. Not everything new is evil or makes you any less of a person than your ancestors. Family is a pretty central part of the film as we can see them bonding and doing a lot of things together.
I was actually expecting a lot less from that movie. So, it's clear that it has surprised me!

The Croods, although it's title implies otherwise, is actually one of the more surprising animated movies. Clever and cheerful, with some decent humour and impressive visuals. It's not groundbreaking and it does have it's cliche and odd moments, but the positives overrule the negatives and despite this, is still a decent film.

This beautifully designed and colourful cartoon sustains its story and pacing very well. It is full of wit, humour and funny lines and it ends on an up beat note with a very moving finale. I must admit to being very resistant to seeing it, but I must confess it's not only (along with Frozen) the best animated film of the year, it's also one of the better films of the year generally. Where most animated films run out of gas long before the end this one delivers in full. A real hoot.

Great movie. If possible, go see the 3D version as the animators really went a long way to make it a true part of the film's look and feel. The storyline is phenomenal, voice acting superb, and there are plenty of laughs for both kids and adults. Definitely one I would gladly watch again.
The cinema room 5 where I live, is not working because the projector can not produce tapes digital theater and I could not see Silver Linings Playbook.

One of the cleanest family movies in a long time, "The Croods" is a fun and brilliantly animated adventure that is high on laughs and yet, low on plot.  The voice actors do a solid job, and solid messages on family and the importance of parenthood are present.  The animation is both amazing and 3D-worthy.

Like Oz the Great and Powerful, and Winnie the Pooh, The Croods succeed in being an awesome kids movie. Every character has there own lovable personality, except the mother who has none, and the message is quite endearing.

I really enjoyed this film because not only is it visually beautiful but it is very funny and emotionally gripping.  The family dinamic really worked for me and the little girl Sandy and the sloth Belt were my favorites.
Story  Average  Action  Excellent  Characters  Excellent  Fun  Excellent, Ending  Average. I totally loved it! 7/10 Very near to 8/10, but i expected (while watching) a little bit more.

This was surprisingly well made. It has a little bit of everything, humor, romance and even some suspense, but very little. It works out well not only for kids, but for adults as well, which has worked out like that since "Toy Story 3". Overall, it's extremely enjoyable.
I enjoyed this one more than I expected. The critics were overly harsh in their criticisms of the movie. The visuals were outstanding, and the plot while a little bit repetitive never got tired.

This a good movie overall. It shows how cavemen lived, in a funny, warmhearted way. I don't really care about the incorrect reference about how certain things were invented. The only thing I consider bad in this movie is that some of the jokes were overdone. But in the end, this is a really good movie. 8/10
I thought this movie had dazzling animation and good special effects.  I thought the story plot was really good and the 3D made the movie a lot better.
It's been a long time i haven't laugh as much. Moreover, each scene is more beautiful than the previous one. The 3d work is remarkable, nothing like the first 3d movies. just FUN

This is a great family movie. I went with my little kid on her birthday and she loved it. On the way back she kept saying the lines over and over again. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a family comedy without any drawbacks.

The Croods was a good, funny, and somewhat charming movie. Although it had some cliches, which is common nowadays because virtually every type of feature a movie could have has already been used in some way, the movie had it's own type of humor, often more creative than in other comedies.

If you're looking for anachronisms in this movie you'll find plenty.  If you're looking for sweet moments, funny moments, clever storytelling, and universal age appeal, you'll also find plenty.  Flat out, this is a great movie to share with your young children.  There is no villain, no actual heartbreak  although there are some extremely touching father/daughter exchanges  just adventure and stunning animation.  While Monsters University will provide laughs and gags, this movie provides simple heart... along the lines of How to Train Your Dragon.  Don't look for complexity, don't look for twists or the unpredictable, just sit back and enjoy the ride... your kids will.
Extremely funny, unique characters and animation. Best Animated Movie ever made. I am hoping for a sequel soon. I soooo love all the characters especially Grandma, so funny!

The beginning does not start out promising (as it tries to take advantage of 3-D), but after its done, the movie gets better and more enjoyable. "The Croods" is just fun. Great animation  wonderfully animated environment, wonderfully animated characters, wonderfully animated creatures (even though its not accurate to the time period), are one of the movies strengths, and the message to try new things works but is predictable. "The Croods" is fast paced, but not as cleverly written as films recently released like "Monsters University". While the movie isn't as deep in emotions, the film passes with its humor and creative spin on our prehistoric world.

I went into this one with very little expectations but found I really enjoyed it.  It took a little getting used to as the film takes place in a fictional era of history where far-fetched animals dot the landscape but, once I got used to seeing ram birds, elephant mice and a saber-tooth tiger I'm sure was part parrot, I found a colorful, fun movie.

A surprisingly heart-warming animation. A family-friendly story that brings laughter and tears. The characters didn't seem interesting at first, but they sure do grow on you! By the end of the movie, you will have discovered a new-found love for the characters and the story itself.

A family oriented comedy about a prehistoric family with modern day issues sounds too far-fetched to be watchable and entertaining, but the story line keeps itself afloat just long enough for the film to structure properly, so that the comedy can blend with the heart of the movie. Though most of the 'heart' is cliched and unoriginal.
One can watch a few good jokes in there but nothing special. Unfortunately, just your average animated movie rather smaller ages. I expected more but it is so weak.

This is a great movie that the whole family will enjoy. Nicholas Cage and the rest of the cast are exellent in their roles. The Croods is an underrated movie that should have been recognized for its story and prehistoric setting.

After the box-office disappointment that was "Rise of the Guardians," DreamWorks decided to take us back to prehistoric times with "The Croods," which they promise us isn't just another "Flintstones." Did they keep that promise? Sort of. "The Croods" is a pretty solid animated film that doesn't quite ascend to new levels for DreamWorks: it's funny, it's well-animated, it's got some exciting moments, and it's basically some solid family-friendly entertainment that doesn't approach the high standard set by DreamWorks or the other animated companies around them. Don't set your expectations sky high on this one, but all in all, "The Croods" is decently entertaining family fare.

This film is amazing  the more you watch it the better it gets. My kids are addicted to it and i have to watch it every day (or part of) don't just watch it once  watch it a few times. as good as toy story 3.

Yeah it's simple,  'primitive' as some might ironically describe, but it was enjoyable in my opinion. It's a good happy flick to fill in an hour or two of a lazy afternoon; cheesy maybe, but not in a painful way, nor is it overly childish.  Cute characters with entertaining interactions, and of course, the gorgeous visuals.
The only part that got me involved throughout was the last part only. The characters are okay. This movie is unforgettable in weeks. But their were some funny moments too which were original.

The Croods es una película de animación que contiene varios y creativos momentos de risa, con buena animación y una historia que logra ser entretenida para así volverse en una gran película del género familiar.

I watched this movie twice, and I loved it. The characters and all their personalities, the animations, the voice actors, the story, it was all good.  Definitely one of the better animated films I've seen in a wile. However, if you held a gun to my head and commanded me to give criticism, I'd say the beginning with the egg and all, was dragged out too long, and the belt monkey animal on Guy was annoying to look at, But all in all, I was entertained, 10/10.
A lukewarm animation, The Croods is full of light fun, entertainment and vibrant visuals and might satisfy it's target audience but for everyone else, doesn't leave a lasting impact on the mind.

The Croods really deserved to be noticed more at the Oscars last year. Brilliant animation quality, heartwarming themes, and a hilarious crew of cavemen combine for a laugh-out-loud movie that will entertain all ages. Certainly one of the best films DreamWorks Animation has produced.
Not bad, not great, it's just okay. I like the connection between the family and the Id buy the chemistry they share, but for me I don't see anything that special about it.
The movie is very good it made me laugh with my father and had some great time.I wish there will be in the future part 2.You must see it totally recommended movie for a family kids and adults!

A visually stunning and very entertaining postmodern crossing of The Flintstones and The Simpsons that will prove exciting for the whole family, offering a touching and quite appealing message about discovery and fear of change.
A fun, entertaining and warm hearted movie perfect for the whole family to enjoy, especially during this holiday season.
Prehistoric times... were there for a reason. They're a part of history. Looks like this movie's attempt to make a comedy adventure on prehistoric times work out. 2013's on the ball with movies.

The movie is at its most interesting and amusing when riffing on how cavemen might have reacted to new experiences and ideas, like fire and shoes. Whether the kiddies will appreciate that is unclear, but they’ll certainly like the voice work done by Emma Stone as Eep.
